sentence.Network_en: The press invade people's privacy unfairly and unjustifiably every day.
sentence.Network_cn: 新闻媒体每天都在不公正地且没有正当理由地侵犯人们的隐私。

sentence.Network_en: The press invade people's privacy unjustifiably every day.
sentence.Network_cn: 每天媒体都会毫无道理地干扰人们的生活。

sentence.Network_en: Researchers must not unjustifiably criticise or disparage other Researchers.
sentence.Network_cn: 研究人员不能不公正地批评或贬损其他研究人员.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 如果在订立合同时，合同或其个别条款不合理地（unjustifiably）对另一方当事人过分有利，也即存在重大失衡的情形时，则处于不利 …
也就是说，只有当某人对我的行为进行无法正当化（unjustifiably）的干涉时，我的自由才受到了损害。或者说，只有当某人阻止我做 …

entry.tran: （尤指伤害他人的行为）不能证明为正当的，无可辩解的，没有道理的
entry.def: If you describe an action, especially one that harms someone, as unjustifiable, you mean there is no good reason for it.

example.ex: Using these missiles to down civilian aircraft is simply immoral and totally unjustifiable.
example.tran: 用这些导弹击落民用飞机是极不道德也是完全没道理的。

auth_sentence.content: But he would not have believed there was a risk of paratroopers firing unjustifiably;
auth_sentence.res_content: But he would not have believed there was a risk of paratroopers firing unjustifiably;
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But he would not have believed there was a risk of paratroopers firing unjustifiably;

auth_sentence.content: But Darvis is not concerned, saying the euro's value has been unjustifiably high in recent months.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Darvis is not concerned, saying the euro's value has been unjustifiably high in recent months.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Darvis is not concerned, saying the euro's value has been unjustifiably high in recent months.

auth_sentence.content: They have, wholly unjustifiably, also hurled imprecations to depict Mr Blair's policy as something it was not: wanton aggression.
